results.title: Efficacy of simvastatin treatment of valvular interstitial cells varies with the extracellular environment.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: These studies represent a significant contribution to understanding how @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ may impact @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Valve_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006349 @@@heart valve calcification@@@.

citations.NLM: Monzack EL, Gu X, Masters KS. Efficacy of simvastatin treatment of valvular interstitial cells varies with the extracellular environment. Arterioscler Thromb Vasc Biol. 2009 Feb;29(2):246-53. PMID: 19023089

results.title: High density lipoprotein from patients with valvular heart disease uncouples endothelial nitric oxide synthase.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Valve_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006349 @@@VHD@@@ received either @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (20mg/d) or routine medications, and endothelial effects of HDL were characterized.

citations.NLM: Chang FJ, Yuan HY, Hu XX, Ou ZJ, Fu L, Lin ZB, Wang ZP, Wang SM, Zhou L, Xu YQ, Wang CP, Xu Z, Zhang X, Zhang CX, Ou JS. High density lipoprotein from patients with valvular heart disease uncouples endothelial nitric oxide synthase. J Mol Cell Cardiol. 2014 Sep;74():209-19. PMID: 24887036
